cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 420 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north-northeast today, reach the northwest Florida Gulf Coast Thursday, cross Florida and move northeast just inland or just offshore the southeastern U.S. coast, then accelerate into the Atlantic off the Mid-Atlantic coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northwest Florida coast near Indian Pass–Aripeka

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Anclote River to Indian Pass, FL; Tropical Storm Watch west of Indian Pass to the Walton/Bay County line (Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: United States East Coast from northern Florida through the Carolinas and potentially southeastern Virginia
weather_observation.wind: Low to moderate chance (up to 17% probability) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (34 kt/39 mph) late Friday into Saturday; gusts could reach 40 mph near the coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the Port of Virginia based on current surge guidance.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rainfall possible Friday night through Saturday with locally higher amounts, which may cause brief ponding and minor flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and swells may disrupt vessel traffic; periods of reduced visibility in heavy rain; minor coastal flooding during high-tide cycles.
